meanings.definition: A member of a lay sisterhood, founded in the Netherlands in the 12th century.
meanings.sent1: The beguines lived together in a community, supporting each other.
meanings.sent2: She learned about the history of the beguines during her visit to the Netherlands.
meanings.sent3: The beguines decided to organize a bake sale to raise funds for their charity work.
meanings.sent4: In the novel, the beguines were portrayed as wise and compassionate women.
meanings.sent5: The beguines' dedication to helping others was truly inspiring.

meanings.sent1: The beguines performed a graceful dance at the cultural festival.
meanings.sent2: The music for the beguines was lively and rhythmic, perfect for dancing.
meanings.sent3: During the dance competition, the beguines surprised everyone with their unique routine.
meanings.sent4: The beguines moved in perfect harmony, captivating the audience with their performance.
meanings.sent5: Her favorite part of the show was when the beguines twirled gracefully on stage.
